edu.rit.pj2.tracker

Class Sender

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.tracker.Sender
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackendSender, JobSender, LauncherSender, TrackerSender

    public abstract class Sender
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Sender is the abstract base class for an object that sends messages. A sender must be attached to a Proxy before the sender can be used.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sender()
      Construct a new sender.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String host()
      Returns the remote host to which this sender is connected.
      int port()
      Returns the remote port to which this sender is connected.
      void shutdown()
      Gracefully shut down communication with the far end.
      void terminate()
      Forcibly terminate communication with the far end.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sender

        public Sender()
        Construct a new sender.

    • Method Detail

      • host

        public java.lang.String host()
        Returns the remote host to which this sender is connected.
        Returns:
        Host name.

      • port

        public int port()
        Returns the remote port to which this sender is connected.
        Returns:
        Port number.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Gracefully shut down communication with the far end. The shutdown() method blocks until the far end acknowledges that communication was shut down.

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Forcibly terminate communication with the far end. The terminate() method returns immediately, without waiting for an acknowledgment from the far end.
